title: Calories in Half an Apple
meta_description: Discover calories in a half an apple, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and quick tweaks for variations like peeled or with toppings.
assumptions: Medium apple (~182 g whole, raw, with skin, no core included in half).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by apple variety, size, ripeness, and preparation; organic vs. conventional may differ slightly. Check sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: Half a medium apple provides ~48 kcal, 12.5 g carbs, and 2.2 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a half an apple?
faqs.a: About 48 kcal for half a medium apple with skin.

faqs.q: What's the fiber in half an apple?
faqs.a: Roughly 2.2 g of dietary fiber, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: Does peeling an apple change calories?
faqs.a: Yes, peeling removes some fiber and caloriesâ€”about 5 kcal less per half.

faqs.q: Are apples low in fat and protein?
faqs.a: Yes, half an apple has ~0.2 g fat and 0.3 g protein, mostly carbs from natural sugars.

faqs.q: How does apple size affect calories in a half?
faqs.a: Smaller apples lower calories (e.g., ~35 kcal/half), larger ones higher (e.g., ~60 kcal/half).
